page.title: 15ENGINEERING - DERWENT VALLEY
page.content: This small firm has its business at Blackhall Mill, south of the River Derwent. It has a total work-force of three but hopes to expand. It began as a blacksmith's in 1896. One employee has been there almost 19 years. They work 8:00a.m. to 4:30p.m. five days a week. Handrails, gates, and tracks for carrying invalid carriages upstairs are some of the articles manufactured from mild steel. Producing a gate may take three hours. The biggest job tackled yet is a 4-storey fire-escape, so travelling is involved. Welding is also done. Tools used, including hammers, jacks and knives, are all handmade. Electric machines are also used. The men enjoy their skilled trade and must wear special clothing; goggles, ear muffs, leather aprons and safety shoes.
